meanings.definition: Acting in a deceitful or dishonest manner.
meanings.sent1: The underhanded thief stole the cookies when no one was looking.
meanings.sent2: She suspected her friend was being underhanded in their business dealings.
meanings.sent3: The underhanded squirrel pretended to be a rock to steal the bird's seeds.
meanings.sent4: His underhanded tactics in the game made him the champion.
meanings.sent5: The underhanded politician promised one thing but did another, betraying the voters' trust.

meanings.sent1: The underhanded plan to surprise her with a birthday party worked perfectly.
meanings.sent2: He made an underhanded deal with the rival company to gain an advantage.
meanings.sent3: The underhanded cat hid behind the curtains to pounce on the unsuspecting mouse.
meanings.sent4: The underhanded whispers in the dark echoed through the empty hallway.
meanings.sent5: Her underhanded smile revealed her secret intentions.

meanings.sent1: The underhanded scheme to frame him for the crime was exposed.
meanings.sent2: The underhanded plot to overthrow the king was foiled by the loyal guards.
meanings.sent3: The underhanded fox tricked the gullible rabbit into giving him all the carrots.
meanings.sent4: The underhanded storm clouds hid the approaching danger.
meanings.sent5: His underhanded behavior cost him the trust of his friends.
